sam3dj.title: sam3DJ
sam3dj.author: 1Turtle
sam3dj.description: Generate 3D prints in MC (Java Edition) via the .3DJ format within the SC-Peripherals mod!
sam3dj.about:
This plugin allows you to **export a model into the .3DJ format**.  
The .3DJ format is _mostly_ used with the `3D Printer` from the **SC-Peripherals** Java Edition mod.  
  
**Tip:** Cubes in a `state_on` folder will be _only_ displayed whenever the model is toggled on!    
> **Note:** _The format does not support the following attributes:_  
> * Rotated cubes  
> * One cube with multiple textures  
> * Cubes outside the given block space *(16x16x16 Grid / 1x1x1 Block)*  
  
Try to avoid those things, or else you might run into weird results.  
Meshes are also not supported due to the limitations of the format and Minecraft.
> For the full format documentations, see the [SwitchCraft3 Wiki](https://docs.sc3.io/whats-new/sc-peripherals.html#_3dj-format)

animated_java.title: Animated Java
animated_java.author: Titus Evans (SnaveSutit)
animated_java.description: A Blockbench plugin that makes complex animation a breeze in Minecraft: Java Edition.

armor_stand_animator.title: Armor Stand Animator
armor_stand_animator.author: DoubleFelix
armor_stand_animator.description: Provides an interface to animate armor stands which is converted to a data pack
armor_stand_animator.about: To start, create the armor stand model by using the "Create Armor Stand Model" action in the toolbar. Then, create your animation in the animate tab as normal. Make sure the snapping value for keyframes is set to 20 for best results. When you're finished, use the "Export Armor Stand Animation" action in the toolbar. Change the settings as needed, then click "Confirm". Animations can be run with "/execute as @e[tag=entity_tag] run function animation_pack:start". The armor stand for an animation can be summoned with "/function animation_pack:create". Supports looping, time scale, block/blockbench unit scale, pausing and playback, and start delays.

animator.title: Java Item Model Animator
animator.author: Command master
animator.description: Takes two java item models and outputs a zip with a resourcepack and a datapack to make a clear transaction between them in the players hand (the plugin can also work for other animations but the datapack have to be coded manually).
animator.about:
The animation is activated using "/scoreboard players set @s animation 0".
To use click Filter -> Save starting model the save the first model, and then click on File -> Export -> Export animation to download the ZIP file of the animation

geenium_bedrock_entity_helper.title: Bedrock Entity Model Presets
geenium_bedrock_entity_helper.author: Geenium
geenium_bedrock_entity_helper.description: Loads Bedrock vanilla entity models up to version 1.13

missing_texture_highlighter.title: Missing Texture Highlighter
missing_texture_highlighter.author: JannisX11
missing_texture_highlighter.description: Highlights missing textures by flashing them.

double_sided_cubes.title: Double Sided Cube Generator
double_sided_cubes.author: SnaveSutit
double_sided_cubes.description: Creates inverted duplicates of the selected cube(s) to allow double-sided rendering in Minecraft: Java Edition.

optimize.title: Optimize
optimize.author: Krozi
optimize.description: Hide concealed faces for better performance!

blockmodels-exporter.title: Export to BlockModels.com
blockmodels-exporter.author: TheDestruc7i0n
blockmodels-exporter.description: Export models from Blockbench directly to BlockModels.com

plaster.title: Plaster
plaster.author: JannisX11
plaster.description: Fixes texture bleeding (small white or colored lines around the edges of your model) by slightly shrinking UV maps

outline_creator.title: Outline Creator
outline_creator.author: Wither
outline_creator.description: Creates stylistic outlines for cubes and meshes using negative scale values.
outline_creator.about: Select an element you want to create an outline for, go to the `Tools` menu and click on the `Create Outline` option.

mod_utils.title: Mod Utils
mod_utils.author: JTK222 (Maintainer), Wither (For the original Techne importer), Ocraftyone (VoxelShape improvements)
mod_utils.description: Allows importing Tabula files, and exporting VoxelShapes

seat_position.title: Seat Position + Hitbox
seat_position.author: JannisX11
seat_position.description: Preview seat positions, hit/selection boxes, and collision boxes for custom MC Bedrock entities and blocks

ambient_occlusion.title: Ambient Occlusion
ambient_occlusion.author: JannisX11
ambient_occlusion.description: Adds a screen space ambient occlusion shader
ambient_occlusion.about: Ambient Occlusion is enabled by default. You can adjust the intensity or disable it in the settings.

csmodel.title: CraftStudio Model Format
csmodel.author: JannisX11
csmodel.description: Allows to import and export CraftStudio Models (.csmodel).
csmodel.about:
To **import** a model from CraftStudio, go to the CraftStudio project settings and export a cspack file. Open this file in an archive manager (like 7zip) and extract the model file. Import the file into Blockbench using the import menu. 
To **export** a file, export a .csmodel file from Blockbench and drop it into an existing .cspack file into the Models folder. Make sure it is using the same file name as the old model in the pack. Import the .cspack into CraftStudio and select the models you want to import.

screencast_keys.title: Screencast Keys
screencast_keys.author: JannisX11
screencast_keys.description: Displays the key combinations you press on screen. Useful for tutorial videos.

discord-rpc.title: Discord RPC
discord-rpc.author: strajabot, Kastle, & simplyme
discord-rpc.description: Show a rich presence status in Discord.

cem_template_loader.title: CEM Template Loader
cem_template_loader.author: Ewan Howell
cem_template_loader.description: Load template Java Edition entity models for use with OptiFine CEM. Also includes an animation editor, so that you can create custom entity animations.

optifine_player_models.title: OptiFine Player Models
optifine_player_models.author: Ewan Howell
optifine_player_models.description: Adds a new format that allows you to create OptiFine player models.
optifine_player_models.about: This plugin adds a new format that allows you to make you own custom OptiFine player models. ## Setup 1. Open your launcher and go to the **Installations** tab. 2. Find your installation, click the triple dot, and slect **Edit**. 3. Select **More Options**. 4. Inside the **JVM ARGUMENTS** field, add: `-Dplayer.models.local=true -Dplayer.models.reload=true` Note: **player.models.reload** reloads the model every 5 seconds in game, and can be disabled after you finish making the model. 5. Make a folder named playermodels inside your **.minecraft** folder. 6. Inside that folder, make 2 more folders named items and users. ## Usage - You need a config file for every player with a player model. This config file must be the players username, and needs to go in the **users** folder. **Example**: `.minecraft/playermodels/users/ewanhowell5195.cfg` - You can create a user config by going to **File > Export > Create OptiFine Player Model Config**. - Exported player models should go in a folder named what the player model is, inside the **items** folder, and be named `model.cfg`. **Example**: `.minecraft/playermodels/items/horns/model.cfg` - If not using **Use Player Texture**, textures must go inside a folder named `users` located next to the model file, and be named the players username. **Example**: `.minecraft/playermodels/items/horns/users/ewanhowell5195.png` ## Limitations - They are client side only. - They are not part of resource packs. - They require OptiFine, and JVM args set in the launcher. - Animations are not supported. - You can only target specific players, not all players. ## Important Enabling the player model JVM arguments **will disable any online player models**, usually being seasonal cosmetics like the Santa and Witch hats.

colour_gradient_generator.title: Colour Gradient Generator
colour_gradient_generator.author: Ewan Howell
colour_gradient_generator.description: Generate hue shifted gradient palettes from a single colour.
colour_gradient_generator.about: This plugin generates hue shifted colour gradient palettes from a single colour. ## Example Input colour Output gradient ## How to use To use this plugin, go into paint mode and change the colour palette mode to Palette or **Both**. You can then select a colour and click on the gradient icon to generate a colour gradient.

collapsible_start_screen_categories.title: Collapsible Start Screen Categories
collapsible_start_screen_categories.author: Ewan Howell
collapsible_start_screen_categories.description: Add the ability to collapse the start screen categories.
collapsible_start_screen_categories.about: This plugin adds a small dropdown arrow next to each category on the start screen, allowing you to collapse each category and hide their respective formats.

preview_scene_customiser.title: Preview Scene Customiser
preview_scene_customiser.author: Ewan Howell
preview_scene_customiser.description: Create your very own preview scenes. Download preview scenes from the Preview Scene Store. Edit and manage existing preview scenes.

splash_art_customiser.title: Splash Art Customiser
splash_art_customiser.author: Ewan Howell
splash_art_customiser.description: Customise the start screen's splash art, by adding your own!
splash_art_customiser.about:
This plugin allows you to customise the start screen's splash art by adding your own! If you add multiple splash art images, you can set it to pick a random one every time your launch Blockbench.

## How to use
On the top left corner of the splash art, you will find a gear icon. From here you can manage your custom splash arts.

## Splash art types
- URL - A splash art can be loaded from a URL (faster loading)
- File - A splash art can be loaded from a file (slower loading)
- Gallery - Pick an image from the [Blockbench Gallery](https://www.blockbench.net/gallery)

## Supported file types
- PNG
- JPG/JPEG
- GIF
- WebP
- SVG

scene_recorder.title: Scene Recorder
scene_recorder.author: Ewan Howell
scene_recorder.description: Add a new scene recorder where you can record your model in a large variety of formats.

backup_viewer.title: Backup Viewer
backup_viewer.author: Ewan Howell
backup_viewer.description: View the project backups from within Blockbench.
backup_viewer.about: Add a backup tab to the Blockbench start screen that allows you to view a list of the project backups from within Blockbench.

activity_tracker.title: Activity Tracker
activity_tracker.author: Ewan Howell
activity_tracker.description: Track how long you spend using Blockbench and working on each project.
activity_tracker.about:
This plugin allows you to keep track of how much time you spend using Blockbench and how long you spend working on each project.

To view your activity stats, go to `Tools > Activity Tracker`. From here you can see all your stats for both Blockbench and the current project.

workspaces.title: Workspaces
workspaces.author: Ewan Howell
workspaces.description: Organise your recent projects into workspaces that you can switch between.

live_dev_reloader.title: Live Dev Reloader
live_dev_reloader.author: Ewan Howell
live_dev_reloader.description: Edit plugins and themes live in any text editor and have them automatically update in Blockbench.

threecore_exporter.title: ThreeCore Exporter
threecore_exporter.author: Lucas, Spyeedy
threecore_exporter.description: Let's you export your models in the json entity model format for the ThreeCore mod!

startup_tips.title: Startup Tips
startup_tips.author: TheOtterlord
startup_tips.description: This plugin provides helpful tips for those unfamiliar with Blockbench
startup_tips.about: The Startup Tips plugin provides helpful tips about Blockbench on startup. These tips include tips about model creation, external resources, the editor, and more

animation_utils.title: GeckoLib Animation Utils
animation_utils.author: Eliot Lash, Gecko, McHorse, AzureDoom, Tslat
animation_utils.description: Create animated blocks, items, entity, and armor using the GeckoLib library and plugin. https://github.com/bernie-g/geckolib/wiki

modded_entity_fabric.title: Fabric Modded Entity
modded_entity_fabric.author: Eliot Lash
modded_entity_fabric.description: Plugin for exporting Modded Entities using Fabric/Yarn Sourcemap

multi-layer.title: Multi-Layer
multi-layer.author: aidancbrady
multi-layer.description: Allows exporting in Forge's multi-layer model format.

light_tracer_uploader.title: Light Tracer Uploader
light_tracer_uploader.author: JannisX11
light_tracer_uploader.description: Upload models to Light Tracer to share them or to create renders

code_view.title: Code View
code_view.author: wither
code_view.description: View the model you are currently editing in the raw format

datagen_export.title: Datagen Export
datagen_export.author: itsmeow
datagen_export.description: Allows exporting to BlockStateProvider datagen code

duplicate_renamer.title: Duplicate Bone Renamer
duplicate_renamer.author: Gecko
duplicate_renamer.description: This plugin renames duplicate bones so they work in bedrock and GeckoLib models

texture_stitcher.title: Texture Stitcher
texture_stitcher.author: McHorse
texture_stitcher.description: Adds a menu item to textures editor that stitches multiple textures into one

arcaniax_block_exporter.title: Bedrock Block Exporter
arcaniax_block_exporter.author: Arcaniax
arcaniax_block_exporter.description: Helps making new Bedrock blocks (requires experimental mode)

bakery.title: Bakery
bakery.author: JannisX11
bakery.description: Bakes complex animations into simple linear keyframes

bedrock_pivot_fix.title: Bedrock Pivot Fix 2
bedrock_pivot_fix.author: JannisX11
bedrock_pivot_fix.description: Rotated cubes are broken in custom-block models in older versions of Minecraft: Bedrock Edition. Use this plugin to fix them.
bedrock_pivot_fix.about: After installing, use **Filter > Fix Bedrock Pivots** to fix your current model.

simplify.title: Simplify Models
simplify.author: Ryan Garrett
simplify.description: Simplifies the cubes in a model. For example if a block was 0.99 pixels wide, then it would change it to 1.

animation_sliders.title: Animation Sliders
animation_sliders.author: JannisX11
animation_sliders.description: Adds multiple sliders to tweak keyframes
animation_sliders.about:
Adds sliders and other tools to modify keyframes:

You can add the sliders and tools to any of your toolbars by clicking the three dots on the right side and selecting **Customize**. Search for the slider you want to add and click to add it.

- **Tween Keyframes:** Amplify the values of the selected keyframes
- **Amplify Keyframes:** Amplify the values of the selected keyframes
- **Ease Keyframes:** Create a curve with the selected keyframes between the adjacent keyframes
- **Retime Keyframes:** Shift the curve in the graph editor without changing the time of the keyframe. This allows you to change the time of one axis individually
- **Keyframe Slider Axis:** Select which axis the keyframe sliders affect
- **Create Keyframe Column:** Key all channels in the timeline at the current timecode, if they already have keyframes
- **Select Keyframe Column:** Select all keyframes in the timeline along a column below the playhead
- **Normalize Keyframes:** Subtract the currently displayed value from all selected keyframes, in order to remove the base pose from the model.

voxel_shape_generator.title: VoxelShape Generators
voxel_shape_generator.author: Spectre0987
voxel_shape_generator.description: Generates Voxel Shapes (Supports Mojang Mappings and MCP)

mimodel_format.title: Mine-imator Model Exporter
mimodel_format.author: JannisX11
mimodel_format.description: Export .mimodel files for Mine-imator and Modelbench

minecraft_entity_wizard.title: Minecraft Entity Wizard
minecraft_entity_wizard.author: JannisX11 & Mojang Studios
minecraft_entity_wizard.description: Create entities for Minecraft: Bedrock Edition! Start with the looks and behavior of a vanilla entity, and turn it into your own creation!

minecraft_block_wizard.title: Minecraft Block Wizard
minecraft_block_wizard.author: JannisX11 & Mojang Studios
minecraft_block_wizard.description: Create custom blocks for Minecraft: Bedrock Edition!

minecraft_item_wizard.title: Minecraft Item Wizard
minecraft_item_wizard.author: JannisX11 & Mojang Studios
minecraft_item_wizard.description: Create custom items for Minecraft: Bedrock Edition!

reference_models.title: Reference Models
reference_models.author: JannisX11
reference_models.description: Load and view glTF reference models in Blockbench

endimations_exporter.title: Endimator Animations Exporter
endimations_exporter.author: SmellyModder
endimations_exporter.description: Exports Blockbench animations as the JSON format for Endimator animations from the Blueprint Mod Library. https://github.com/team-abnormals/blueprint

brush_randomizer.title: Brush Color Randomizer
brush_randomizer.author: Anniken(YT)
brush_randomizer.description: Randomize the Brush Color with each stroke to give your artwork more variation

cardinal.title: Cardinal
cardinal.author: Bug1312
cardinal.description: Adds in all cardinal directions on the grid and renders them on-top of everything while facing the camera.
cardinal.about: If you wish to change the color, use custom CSS to set the variable 'cardinal' to any color! The scale can be changed from within the settings.

mesh_tools.title: MTools
mesh_tools.author: Malik12tree
mesh_tools.description: Adds powerful mesh modeling tools, operators and generators!

wasd_controls.title: WASD Controls
wasd_controls.author: JannisX11
wasd_controls.description: Adds a WASD controlled viewport navigation mode
wasd_controls.about:
The WASD mode can be enabled from the View menu.
The keys can be remapped in the keybindings menu.
The sensitivity can be changed in the settings under Preview, along with the movement plane.
Hold Control to move faster.

skin_packager.title: Minecraft Skin Pack Packager
skin_packager.author: JannisX11
skin_packager.description: Create Skin Packs for the Minecraft Marketplace
skin_packager.about:
Generates skin packs for the Minecraft Marketplace.
All textures in all open tabs count as skins. You can load individual skins into Blockbench via **File** > **Import Minecraft Skins**.
You can also create new skins via **New** > **Minecraft Skin**, in the File menu or on the start screen.
Export a skin pack via **File** > **Export** > **Export Skin Pack**.

tint_preview.title: Tint Preview
tint_preview.author: MrCrayfish
tint_preview.description: Quickly preview a color on tint enabled faces!
tint_preview.about:
Tint Preview is a tool to help designers who work with the tint face feature of Java Block/Item models. It features the ability to quickly preview a color on tint enabled faces. Tint Preview adds two new actions to the Tools menu that allows you to toggle tinting and change the tint color.
**Important:** This plugin is designed for Java Block/Item models only and will not work for other formats.

pie_menu.title: Pie Menus
pie_menu.author: Malik12tree
pie_menu.description: Add pie shaped menus for faster work.
pie_menu.about:
Built-in Pies

Add Pie Keybind:

ctrl + shift + a

Import Pie Keybind:

shift + q

Export Pie Keybind:

shift + w

Mode Pie Keybind:

shift + tab (web: shift + x)

View Mode Pie Keybind:

alt + z

Toolbox Pie Keybind:

shift + t

New Pie Keybind:

shift + n

Preferences Pie Keybind:

shift + o

Rotate Pie Keybind:

shift + r

Flip Pie Keybind:

shift + f

Center Pie Keybind:

shift + c

Properties Pie Keybind:

shift + p

API

CSS Variables

NameDefaultDescription
--pie-dir_idct_size10%sets the angle indicator size
--pie-major_radius30pxsets the center pie's radius
--pie-major_thickness22pxsets the center pie's thickness

quick_box_uv_layout.title: Quick Box-UV Layout
quick_box_uv_layout.author: Manuel-3
quick_box_uv_layout.description: Button that changes UV of a Per-face cube into Box-UV layout.
quick_box_uv_layout.about: This plugin simply adds a button that rearranges your individual Per-face UV rectangles in the same way Box-UV mode would. This is handy if you want to use the standard Box-UV format, but also have the flexibility of Per-face UV mode.

animation_to_java.title: Animation to Java Converter
animation_to_java.author: MG, Vincent_Huto(PR), DailyCraft(PR), MarcusSlover(PR)
animation_to_java.description: Converts Blockbench animations to Java code for the new 1.19+ keyframe system.
animation_to_java.about: This plugin exports your Blockbench animations as Java code to be used for the new 1.19+ keyframe system. Please note that this system does not support Molang or step interpolation.

root_motion_extractor.title: Root Motion Extractor
root_motion_extractor.author: Tschipp
root_motion_extractor.description: Attempts to extract root motion from an animation
root_motion_extractor.about: This plugin extracts the velocity in m/s for an animation, and provides a value to be used in a movement component to achieve that exact speed. This helps reduce/eliminate foot sliding.

ground_plane_editor.title: Ground Plane Editor
ground_plane_editor.author: SirJain
ground_plane_editor.description: Edits the opacity and color of the ground plane feature in Blockbench.
ground_plane_editor.about:
This simple plugin allows you to customize the ground plane feature in Blockbench; more specifically, the opacity and color.
## How to use
To use this plugin, simply go to `Tools > Ground Plane Editor`, fill out the appropriate categories, and hit `Done`. You can choose to edit either the color, the opacity, or both!

Please report any bugs or suggestions you may have.

custom_marker_colors.title: Custom Marker Colors
custom_marker_colors.author: SirJain and Geode
custom_marker_colors.description: Allows users to add their own marker colors.
custom_marker_colors.about: To make a new custom marker, go to Tools > Marker Colors > Add Custom Color to get started with making your own custom marker color. Once you are done, click Confirm. You will now see your marker color in the default color list. And finally, if you ever choose to view or edit your marker colors, you can use Tools > Marker Colors > Manage Marker Colors

resourcepack_packager.title: Resourcepack Packager
resourcepack_packager.author: leopoldhub
resourcepack_packager.description: Export your java models and texture into a resourcepack

grayscale_preview.title: Grayscale Preview
grayscale_preview.author: JannisX11
grayscale_preview.description: Adds a Grayscale preview mode. The mode can be toggled from the View menu.

brush.title: Brush Plus
brush.author: Malik12tree
brush.description: Create/Use custom brushes with dynamic behavior!

pluginstats.title: Plugin Statistics
pluginstats.author: Malik12tree
pluginstats.description: View download statistics of your blockbench plugin

repeat_it.title: Repeat It
repeat_it.author: Ocraftyone
repeat_it.description: Allows you to repeat cubes with a translation applied to each new object
repeat_it.about:
Allows you to repeat cubes with a translation applied to each new object.

At this time, the only shape that can be copied are cubes, but this may be updated in the future.

cameras.title: Cameras
cameras.author: JannisX11
cameras.description: Adds cameras to Blockbench. Cameras allow you to view the model from different angles, and can be animated to create camera paths.
cameras.about: Cameras can be added through the Edit menu. Enabling Split Screen from View > Split Screen is recommended to preview what the camera can see while editing it. Right-click the camera in the viewport to link or unlink it to the viewport.

image_centering.title: Image Centering
image_centering.author: SirJain
image_centering.description: Adds a button and a keybind that centers the image viewport in an Image format.
image_centering.about:
This plugin adds a button that allows you to reset your viewport in the Image format.
## How to use
To use this plugin, go to the brush toolbar (top of the image mode) and click the `Center Image Viewport` button. If it doesn't show up, make sure you are in the Image format. If you are, you can add the tool using the `Customize Toolbar` option. There will be a confirmation message displayed on-screen once you center the viewport.

Please report any bugs or suggestions you may have.

bbs_exporter.title: BBS Model Ex/importer
bbs_exporter.author: McHorse
bbs_exporter.description: Adds actions to export/import models in BBS format, which is used by BBS machinima studio.

highlight_generator.title: Highlight Mod Shape Generator
highlight_generator.author: ThatGravyBoat
highlight_generator.description: Generates Shape JSONs for the Highlight mod. Mod can be found at: https://links.resourcefulbees.com/highlight

obj_animation_export.title: OBJ Animation Exporter
obj_animation_export.author: JannisX11
obj_animation_export.description: Exports an animation to OBJ as an OBJ file sequence
obj_animation_export.about: To export, right click an animation and click Export OBJ Sequence.

explorer.title: Explorer
explorer.author: JannisX11
explorer.description: Navigate the files in your project from the sidebar in Blockbench!
explorer.about: Use the folder icon in the left corner of the tab bar to open the explorer. Click files to peak into them, double click to jump into the file. Right click a file to bring up the context menu.

performance_audit.title: Performance Audit
performance_audit.author: JannisX11
performance_audit.description: Find performance issues and bottlenecks in your Blockbench installation.
performance_audit.about: You can run a performance audit via Help > Audit Performance.

mc_text_generator.title: Text Generator
mc_text_generator.author: SirJain
mc_text_generator.about:
This plugin adds a button under the `Tools` menu that allows you to generate Minecraft-like text.
## How to use
To use this plugin, go to `Tools > Generate Text`. Simply enter some text, configure your settings how you like, and press `Generate`!

Please report any bugs or suggestions you may have.

utility_flaggers.title: Utility Flaggers
utility_flaggers.author: SirJain and DerfX
utility_flaggers.description: Flashes elements based on template conditions.
utility_flaggers.about: This plugin allows you to flash elements that meet certain preset conditions on-screen.\n## How to use\nTo use this plugin, simply go to `Tools -> Utility Flaggers`. Pick a preset option, fill out your preferred settings, and press `Flag`!

skin_mirror.title: Skin Mirror
skin_mirror.author: oectway
skin_mirror.description: Tool that allows you to mirror the arms and legs of existing skins to the other side.
skin_mirror.about: This plugin adds a button under the `Tools` menu that allows you to mirror the arms and legs of existing skins to the other side. Select the type of the skin: Alek (3 Pixel Arm, customSlim) or Steve (4 Pixel Arm, custom). Next, choose whether you want to mirror from left to right, or the other way around. If everything is correct, click "Confirm".

animation_to_jsonea.title: Animation to JsonEA Converter
animation_to_jsonea.author: Gaming32
animation_to_jsonea.description: Converts Blockbench animations to the json format for the Json Entity Animation mod

azurelib_utils.title: AzureLib Animator
azurelib_utils.author: AzureDoom, Eliot Lash, Gecko, McHorse
azurelib_utils.description: Create animated blocks, items, entity, and armor using the AzureLib library and plugin. This is a fork of Geckolib and cross compatibility will not be promised in the future.

cube_inverter.title: Cube Inverter
cube_inverter.author: SirJain
cube_inverter.description: Adds a button that inverts selected cube sizes.
cube_inverter.about:
This plugin adds a button that inverts the size values of each selected cube.
## How to use
To use this plugin, go to the toolbar at the top of the screen (the one with the move, resize, and rotation tools) and click the `Invert Cubes` button. If you don't see the button, make sure to select some cubes. The button is also keybinded with a default of `Shift + I`.

Please report any bugs or suggestions you may have.

figura_format.title: Figura Model Format
figura_format.author: Katt (KitCat962)
figura_format.description: Create models for the Figura mod in a custom format that optimizes Blockbench to work with Figura models.

rainbow_road_game.title: Rainbow Road Game
rainbow_road_game.author: JannisX11
rainbow_road_game.description: The rainbow road racing minigame from April fools day 2024! Turn your model into a race car and take it for a spin!
